'''Marroc Brandybuck''' was a Hobbit of [[Buckland]].

==History==
Marroc was the youngest son of [[Gormadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Malva Headstrong]].  He had many descendants.<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Marroc'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

A Kngiht of the Round Table named ''Marrok'' is mentioned in Malory's ''Le Morte Darthure''.<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 203</ref>
